::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-4 .top-story-text}
## Food for Thought: Using AI to support food and nutrition policy
To develop healthy diet plans, policy makers need to know what foods people are buying and the nutritional content of those foods -- but that information is in separate datasets. Can machine learning link them together? That question inspired a competition. A new collection of articles tells the full story.
:::
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-8 .top-story-img}
![](case-studies/posts/2023/08/21/images/05-lm.png)
:::

Welcome to the home of **Real World Data Science**, a new project from the [Royal Statistical Society](https://rss.org.uk/). This site and its content are being created and curated by data science practitioners and leaders with a single goal in mind: to help you deliver high quality, ethical, impactful data science in your workplace.
:::

## We have a plethora of jobs that we cannot fill in data science at the moment. We’ve had all sorts of initiatives in terms of trying to retrain people... but unless we get that pipeline coming through [from schools], we’re always going to have this problem at the top. Data is everywhere – in every single thing that we do, in all of our walks of life... so there is absolutely no reason why we can’t excite children in a career in data science.
Rachel Hilliam calls for data science outreach in schools 

::: {.button}
[Watch the lecture](viewpoints/editors-blog/posts/2023/07/27/schools-outreach.qmd)

## Despite some stumbles, OpenAI’s 'junior programmer' presents a real step forward in the ChatGPT offering. At this stage, I would argue that Code Interpreter may be useful for quick summaries, visualisations and a little basic data cleaning and some preliminary investigations. However, based on what I’ve seen so far, it is clear to me that highly trained statisticians won’t be replaced anytime soon.
Real World Data Science takes ChatGPT's Code Interpreter for a test drive
